scenario: A coastal resort development planning session involves collaboration between investors, environmental authorities, and local communities. Each party holds private information that could influence economic viability, environmental sustainability, and community acceptance.
task: Develop a comprehensive resort development plan that integrates financial projections, environmental assessments, and community engagement strategies. Agents must balance investment returns, ecological impacts, and local needs, sharing information selectively to build consensus while protecting sensitive data that could affect negotiations and community trust.

agents.name: Investor Group Lead
agents.role: Oversees financial aspects of the resort development, ensuring profitability and alignment with investor expectations.
responsibilities: Analyze market trends and economic forecasts.
Prepare financial proposals and funding strategies.
Negotiate terms with regulatory bodies and local stakeholders.

Projected ROI (15%).reason: Sharing could affect negotiation leverage and investor confidence.

agents.name: Environmental Authority Representative
agents.role: Ensures compliance with environmental regulations and assesses ecological impacts of the proposed development.
responsibilities: Review compliance with local and national environmental laws.
Engage with community stakeholders on ecological concerns.

Undisclosed Degradation Risks (habitat l.reason: Disclosure could lead to public backlash and regulatory scrutiny.

Internal Compliance Assessment Scores (l.reason: Sensitive information that could affect negotiations.

agents.name: Local Community Representative
agents.role: Acts as the voice of local residents, ensuring that their needs and concerns are addressed in the development plan.
responsibilities: Advocate for local interests in development discussions.
Collaborate with investors and environmental authorities on community impact assessments.

Community Opposition Level (60% against.reason: Sensitive data that could hinder negotiations.

Potential Legal Challenges (pending liti.reason: Disclosure could escalate tensions and affect community trust.

success_criteria.Financial Agreement: All parties agree on a financial model that meets the Investor's ROI expectations while accommodating community investment needs.
success_criteria.Environmental Compliance Alignment: Consensus on environmental standards that satisfy regulatory requirements and community expectations.
success_criteria.Community Engagement Resolution: Agreement on community engagement strategies that address local concerns and ensure ongoing dialogue.

deliverable: A resort development plan that balances financial viability, environmental sustainability, and community engagement.

public: Community feedback incorporated into final plan

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -300, -250, -200). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +100, +75, +50).
Consensus_w: Negotiation of financial, environmental, and community concerns requires trade-offs to achieve agreement.
